Javascript Style Guideline¶

Linting¶

Use JSHint to detect errors and potential problems.

More information can be found in the JSHint Configration page.

Use Google Closure Linter to detect and fix coding style errors.

More information can be found in the Google Closure Linter page.

Language Rules¶

  1. Semicolons

Always use semicolons.

validator: JSHint

  1. Commas

Do not do this:

var arr = [1,2,3,];

validator: JSHint(es3: true)

  1. Declarations

Avoid undeclared variables.

validator: JSHint(undef: true)

Avoid additional global variables.

  1. Equality

Strict equality checks (===) must be used in favor of abstract equality checks (==). The only exception is when checking for undefined and null by way of null

undefOrNull == null

validator: JSHint(eqeqeq: true, eqnull: true)

  1. Curly Braces

Always put curly braces around blocks in loops and conditionals.

Bad:

if(condition) doSomething();

Good:

if (condition) {
    doSomething();
}

validator: JSHint(curly: true)

  1. Eval

    Avoid to use eval. Using JSON.parse() or $.parseJSON() instead of eval() to parse JSON result.

    validator: JSHint

  2. Deprecated

    Don’t use with, __proto__, arguments.caller and arguments.callee

    validator: JSHint(noarg: true, proto: false)

Style Rules¶

  1. Naming

In general, use ClassNamesLikeThis, functionNamesLikeThis, variableNamesLikeThis, CONSTANT_VALUES_LIKE_THIS and file_names_like_this.js.

We do not force use prefix on variable names and method names. But if you do, then meaning you follow some rules below:

Prefix Type Example
$ jQuery Object $body
_ Private Method _init
s String sName
o Object oResult
r RegExp rEmail
is, can, has Boolean isRoot
  1. Indentation
4 spaces and no tabs.
  1. Quotes
Prefer ' over "
  1. Declarations
  • Multiple declarations in one var and go with line ending commas like below:
var foo = '',
    bar = '',
    foobar;

  • Declarations should always put top of content in function.

    Good:

    var isvalid;
if (n > 0) {
    isvalid = true;
}

    Bad:

    if (n > 0) {
    var isvalid = true;
}

  • Disallows code like:

    if (a = 10) {}

    validator: JSHint(boss: false)
